department: Art of Africa and the Americas
description: mask with protruding round eyes wrapped with plant fiber; long hair is tied in bundles and attached in eight separate groups; upper and lower lip lined with spotted fur; feathers placed horizontally through sewn channel across upper lip; 3-inch crescent-shaped wood pieces hang around lower half of mask with short hair below
medium: Wood, fur, feathers, hair, cloth, plant fiber
text: How many eyes do you need' Depends what you’re trying to accomplish—in this a formidable appearance to command authority. The two pairs of eyes, one deeply set into the face and the other protruding like cylinders, combine with a large, open mouth and faux leopard teeth to convey power and aggression. And while it is rarely possible to identify the specific function of a Wee mask by its shape, this one was likely used to maintain social control and order.
title: Mask
